general_advisory: As per extended range of forecast received from IMD, fairly widespread rain/thundershower is very likely over districts of Odisha during the week-1 (6th - 12th September, 2024) with isolated heavy rainfall very likely in the districts of South Odisha on 6th Sept; isolated heavy to very heavy rainfall very likely in the districts of South Odisha on 7th Sept; isolated heavy to very heavy rainfall very likely in the districts of Central Odisha on 8th Sept, heavy rainfall very likely over the districts of North Odisha on 9th and 10th Sept. Scattered to fairly widespread rain/thundershower very likely in the district of Odisha state during week 2 (13th - 19th September, 2024). In view of five days weather forecast received from IMD, farmers are advised to withhold application of fertilizers and plant protection chemicals for the time being. Apply balanced and appropriate fertilizers according to cropâ€™s growth stage. Avoid excess nitrogen as it promotes excessive vegetative growth and increase water demand. Always consider an integrated approach of preventive measures together with biological treatment if available to protect the crop from pests. Extensive insecticide use can lead to resistance in the pest. To prevent this, ensure proper rotation between insecticides and use mixtures. Use light trap to monitor insect population so that timely control measure can be taken. SMS Advisory - Apply Urea @ 25kg/ac if crop is at tasseling stage (9 week) in Maize.

advisory: Farmers are advised to spray of leaf extracts of Bael, Tulsi, or Neem per litre of water for reducing the incidence of insects & diseases.
Install Pheromone traps to monitor and control the population of stem borer, leaf folder, and rice ear-eating caterpillar.
Application of plant hormone Planofix at 60-65 DAS for improving the seed cotton yield.
Apply total killer herbicide glyphosate or Glufosinate Ammonium 13.5% for weed control.
To control leaf webber infestation, spray Profenophos 50% EC or Chlorpyriphos 50% + Cypermethrin 5% EC per litre of water.
Apply Urea @ 25kg/ac if crop is at tasseling stage and irrigate if water is not sufficient.
Monitor the field regularly for signs of pest infestation.
Install yellow sticky trap to monitor sucking pests.
Spray Tebuconazole at 200ml/acre + Streptocycline at 30g/acre at the root zone.
Install Blue sticky trap to monitor thrips infestation.
If symptoms of thrips infestation are seen, spray neem-based pesticide Azadiractin at initial stage of infestation.
Now is the suitable time for raising tomato seedlings.
Give 1 kg of concentrate for every 2 kg of milk to dairy animals due to high moisture content in grasses during rainy days.
Keep dry fodder and straw ready at home for sheep and goat in rainy season and ensure the practice of flushing to give balanced concentrate to sheep and goat one month prior to kidding and lambing.
Clean poultry houses every day and change the feed and water of poultry birds frequently.
Bury dead poultry birds and sanitize the place with bleaching powder.
Do not bring poultry birds or eggs to home from the affected area.
